custom_steps.title: Introduction
custom_steps.text: These are my blueberry muffins.

custom_steps.title: Favorite Muffin
custom_steps.text: Hmm, My Favorite Muffin.

custom_steps.title: Add Lemon Zest and Milk
custom_steps.text: To a large mixing bowl, add grated lemon zest and a milk of choice (we're using soy milk).

custom_steps.title: Add Sugar, Oil, and Vanilla
custom_steps.text: Add sugar, a neutral vegetable oil, and vanilla extract.

custom_steps.title: Mix Wet Ingredients
custom_steps.text: Whisk until the ingredients are well combined.

custom_steps.title: Sift Dry Ingredients
custom_steps.text: Sift the flour with baking powder and a pinch of salt.

custom_steps.title: Combine Wet and Dry Ingredients
custom_steps.text: Whisk wet and dry ingredients for a short minute until lumps are gone, but without over mixing.

custom_steps.title: Prepare Blueberries
custom_steps.text: Rinse the blueberries, shake the water off, then add them to a bowl and toss them with cornstarch.

custom_steps.title: Add Blueberries to Batter
custom_steps.text: Add the blueberries to the batter and gently fold them in.

custom_steps.title: Transfer Batter to Liners
custom_steps.text: Transfer the batter to the muffin liners. You should be able to make 12 muffins.

custom_steps.title: Fill Muffin Liners
custom_steps.text: Fill the muffin liners almost to the top.

custom_steps.title: Optional: Sprinkle Sugar
custom_steps.text: You can sprinkle some sugar on top or not. We're not going to do it because we eat them for breakfast.

custom_steps.title: Bake Muffins
custom_steps.text: Bake in a preheated oven for 22 and a half minutes or until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out dry.

custom_steps.title: Cool Muffins
custom_steps.text: Let the muffins cool down for about 30 minutes.

custom_steps.title: Conclusion
custom_steps.text: Easy, right?

common_steps.title: Introduction
common_steps.text: These are my blueberry muffins.

common_steps.title: Favorite Muffin
common_steps.text: Hmm, My Favorite Muffin.

common_steps.title: Prepare Wet Ingredients
common_steps.text: To a large mixing bowl, add grated lemon zest and a milk of choice (we're using soy milk).
common_steps.explanation: In a separate bowl, combine wet ingredients such as milk, eggs, sugar, oil or butter, and vanilla extract. Whisk or beat until well combined. For some recipes, additional ingredients like sour cream, lemon zest, or extracts may be added.

common_steps.title: Prepare Wet Ingredients
common_steps.text: Add sugar, a neutral vegetable oil, and vanilla extract.
common_steps.explanation: In a separate bowl, combine wet ingredients such as milk, eggs, sugar, oil or butter, and vanilla extract. Whisk or beat until well combined. For some recipes, additional ingredients like sour cream, lemon zest, or extracts may be added.

common_steps.title: Prepare Wet Ingredients
common_steps.text: Whisk until the ingredients are well combined.
common_steps.explanation: In a separate bowl, combine wet ingredients such as milk, eggs, sugar, oil or butter, and vanilla extract. Whisk or beat until well combined. For some recipes, additional ingredients like sour cream, lemon zest, or extracts may be added.

common_steps.title: Prepare Dry Ingredients
common_steps.text: Sift the flour with baking powder and a pinch of salt.
common_steps.explanation: Combine all-purpose flour, baking powder, and salt in a bowl. Sift or whisk together to ensure even distribution. For variations, you may also add cocoa powder, spices, or other dry flavorings at this stage.

common_steps.title: Combine Wet and Dry Ingredients
common_steps.text: Whisk wet and dry ingredients for a short minute until lumps are gone, but without over mixing.
common_steps.explanation: Gradually add the dry ingredients to the wet ingredients, mixing until just combined. Avoid over-mixing to ensure the muffins remain tender and fluffy.

common_steps.title: Prepare Add-ins
common_steps.text: Rinse the blueberries, shake the water off, then add them to a bowl and toss them with cornstarch.
common_steps.explanation: If using add-ins like blueberries, chocolate chips, or nuts, coat them lightly with flour to prevent sinking. Gently fold them into the batter.

common_steps.title: Prepare Add-ins
common_steps.text: Add the blueberries to the batter and gently fold them in.
common_steps.explanation: If using add-ins like blueberries, chocolate chips, or nuts, coat them lightly with flour to prevent sinking. Gently fold them into the batter.

common_steps.title: Fill Muffin Liners
common_steps.text: Transfer the batter to the muffin liners. You should be able to make 12 muffins.
common_steps.explanation: Line a muffin tin with paper liners or grease it. Fill each liner with batter, typically about two-thirds to three-quarters full. Optionally, sprinkle with sugar or streusel topping.

common_steps.title: Fill Muffin Liners
common_steps.text: Fill the muffin liners almost to the top.
common_steps.explanation: Line a muffin tin with paper liners or grease it. Fill each liner with batter, typically about two-thirds to three-quarters full. Optionally, sprinkle with sugar or streusel topping.

common_steps.title: Fill Muffin Liners
common_steps.text: You can sprinkle some sugar on top or not. We're not going to do it because we eat them for breakfast.
common_steps.explanation: Line a muffin tin with paper liners or grease it. Fill each liner with batter, typically about two-thirds to three-quarters full. Optionally, sprinkle with sugar or streusel topping.

common_steps.title: Bake Muffins
common_steps.text: Bake in a preheated oven for 22 and a half minutes or until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out dry.
common_steps.explanation: Preheat the oven to the specified temperature (usually between 350°F and 425°F). Bake the muffins for the recommended time, usually between 20 to 35 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean.

common_steps.title: Cool and Serve
common_steps.text: Let the muffins cool down for about 30 minutes.
common_steps.explanation: Allow the muffins to cool in the tin for a few minutes before transferring them to a wire rack to cool completely. Serve warm or at room temperature.

common_steps.title: Conclusion
common_steps.text: Easy, right?

subtitles.text: now that i've successfully learned how
to make muffins i had to make a triple
chocolate version
add all the wet ingredients to a bowl
and whisk until combined in another bowl
add the flour cocoa powder and caster
sugar and whisk these together then add
your chocolate chips coating them in the
flour help stop them from sinking
fold the wet ingredients into the mix
then refrigerate for at least one hour
this helps them rise without overflowing
scoop the batter into muffin cases then
top with a mix of chocolate chips follow
these bacon instructions and that's it
enjoy

custom_steps.title: Introduction
custom_steps.text: Now that I've successfully learned how to make muffins, I had to make a triple chocolate version.

custom_steps.title: Add Wet Ingredients
custom_steps.text: Add all the wet ingredients to a bowl and whisk until combined.

custom_steps.title: Add Dry Ingredients
custom_steps.text: In another bowl, add the flour, cocoa powder, and caster sugar, and whisk these together.

custom_steps.title: Add Chocolate Chips
custom_steps.text: Add your chocolate chips, coating them in the flour to help stop them from sinking.

custom_steps.title: Combine Ingredients
custom_steps.text: Fold the wet ingredients into the dry mix.

custom_steps.title: Refrigerate Batter
custom_steps.text: Refrigerate the batter for at least one hour. This helps them rise without overflowing.

custom_steps.title: Scoop Batter
custom_steps.text: Scoop the batter into muffin cases.

custom_steps.title: Top with Chocolate Chips
custom_steps.text: Top with a mix of chocolate chips.

custom_steps.title: Bake Muffins
custom_steps.text: Follow the baking instructions.

custom_steps.title: Enjoy
custom_steps.text: Enjoy your triple chocolate muffins.

common_steps.title: Introduction
common_steps.text: Now that I've successfully learned how to make muffins, I had to make a triple chocolate version.

common_steps.title: Prepare Wet Ingredients
common_steps.text: Add all the wet ingredients to a bowl and whisk until combined.
common_steps.explanation: In a separate bowl, combine wet ingredients such as milk, eggs, sugar, oil or butter, and vanilla extract. Whisk or beat until well combined. For some recipes, additional ingredients like sour cream, lemon zest, or extracts may be added.

common_steps.title: Prepare Dry Ingredients
common_steps.text: In another bowl, add the flour, cocoa powder, and caster sugar, and whisk these together.
common_steps.explanation: Combine all-purpose flour, baking powder, and salt in a bowl. Sift or whisk together to ensure even distribution. For variations, you may also add cocoa powder, spices, or other dry flavorings at this stage.

common_steps.title: Prepare Add-ins
common_steps.text: Add your chocolate chips, coating them in the flour to help stop them from sinking.
common_steps.explanation: If using add-ins like blueberries, chocolate chips, or nuts, coat them lightly with flour to prevent sinking. Gently fold them into the batter.

common_steps.title: Combine Wet and Dry Ingredients
common_steps.text: Fold the wet ingredients into the dry mix.
common_steps.explanation: Gradually add the dry ingredients to the wet ingredients, mixing until just combined. Avoid over-mixing to ensure the muffins remain tender and fluffy.

common_steps.title: Refrigerate Batter
common_steps.text: Refrigerate the batter for at least one hour. This helps them rise without overflowing.

common_steps.title: Fill Muffin Liners
common_steps.text: Scoop the batter into muffin cases.
common_steps.explanation: Line a muffin tin with paper liners or grease it. Fill each liner with batter, typically about two-thirds to three-quarters full. Optionally, sprinkle with sugar or streusel topping.

common_steps.title: Top with Chocolate Chips
common_steps.text: Top with a mix of chocolate chips.

common_steps.title: Bake Muffins
common_steps.text: Follow the baking instructions.
common_steps.explanation: Preheat the oven to the specified temperature (usually between 350°F and 425°F). Bake the muffins for the recommended time, usually between 20 to 35 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean.

common_steps.title: Cool and Serve
common_steps.text: Enjoy your triple chocolate muffins.
common_steps.explanation: Allow the muffins to cool in the tin for a few minutes before transferring them to a wire rack to cool completely. Serve warm or at room temperature.

custom_steps.title: Introduction
custom_steps.text: Do you love moist fluffy chocolate chip muffins with that sky-high bakery top and a nice crisp edge?

custom_steps.title: Today's Recipe
custom_steps.text: Today, I'm going to show you how to make them.

custom_steps.title: Host Introduction
custom_steps.text: Hey, you're watching Preppy Kitchen where I, John Canel, teach you how to make delicious homemade dishes to share with your family and friends.

custom_steps.title: Recipe Start
custom_steps.text: These chocolate chip muffins are going to whip up in a snap, so let's get started.

custom_steps.title: Preheat Oven
custom_steps.text: First off, set that oven to 425 degrees Fahrenheit.

custom_steps.title: Importance of High Heat
custom_steps.text: We want a really high blast of heat when these go in because that'll set the edge and let them rise up so you'll have a nice bakery-style dome on top.

custom_steps.title: Temperature Explanation
custom_steps.text: If you did 350, they would spread out and it just wouldn't be the right kind of muffin.

custom_steps.title: Dry Ingredients
custom_steps.text: Okay, now for the dry ingredients.

custom_steps.title: Using a Scale
custom_steps.text: I'm using a scale because that gives you the most accurate results.

custom_steps.title: Measuring Flour
custom_steps.text: If you're using cups, click up here for my how to measure flour video. It shows you all the ins and outs of measuring flour correctly.

custom_steps.title: Common Baking Mistake
custom_steps.text: It's a thing that goes wrong the most often in baking and it sucks when you add too much flour.

custom_steps.title: Add Flour
custom_steps.text: Into my bowl and I'm using a sifter here, I'm adding in two and three-quarter cups, that is 330 grams of all-purpose flour.

custom_steps.title: Add Salt
custom_steps.text: One teaspoon of salt.

custom_steps.title: Importance of Salt
custom_steps.text: That might seem like a lot, but you want some contrast to all that chocolate and the sugar, so it'll really amp the flavor up and let you appreciate what's going on in the muffin.

custom_steps.title: Add Baking Powder
custom_steps.text: For leavening, I'm using one tablespoon of baking powder. It's kind of a lot of leavening agent, but this is how you get that bakery-style top.

custom_steps.title: Sift Dry Ingredients
custom_steps.text: Sift it out.

custom_steps.title: Whisk Dry Ingredients
custom_steps.text: Give it a quick whisk and set it aside.

custom_steps.title: Melt Butter
custom_steps.text: This was melted a minute ago, it already cooled down. I'm going to put it into the microwave.

custom_steps.title: Room Temperature Ingredients
custom_steps.text: For the wet ingredients, it's important that you're dealing with room temperature things. If it gets cold, we're going to warm it up in the microwave.

custom_steps.title: Add Milk
custom_steps.text: 300 ml or 1 1/4 cups of whole milk.

custom_steps.title: Add Butter
custom_steps.text: Half a cup or 113 grams of unsalted butter that's been melted.

custom_steps.title: Host's Note
custom_steps.text: Today is the first time ever in the history of Preppy Kitchen that Brian is filming. You wanna say hi? No, he's eating cookies that I made.

custom_steps.title: Add Sugar
custom_steps.text: One cup or 200 grams of sugar right in that bowl. Let's give it a whisk to bring it together.

custom_steps.title: Mix Wet Ingredients
custom_steps.text: If you notice some clumps of butter happen when you mix it all together, pop it into the microwave for 40 seconds and it should be totally fine.

custom_steps.title: Add Eggs and Sour Cream
custom_steps.text: Two large eggs and one-quarter cup of sour cream. If you don't have that, you can use full-fat plain yogurt.

custom_steps.title: Optional Vanilla
custom_steps.text: This is optional, but I am adding one tablespoon of vanilla.

custom_steps.title: Mix Wet Ingredients
custom_steps.text: Mix this up. If the butter turns into a mush, pop it into the microwave after whisking the eggs in.

custom_steps.title: Fix Butter Clumps
custom_steps.text: A little heat will fix all of our problems. Give it a whisk to get a nice homogeneous fluid mixture.

custom_steps.title: Combine Wet and Dry Ingredients
custom_steps.text: Pour the wet into the dry, give it a whisk, and take it to almost combined. You could have a couple of clumps of flour hanging out here and there.

custom_steps.title: Add Chocolate Chips
custom_steps.text: We'll do more mixing once those chocolate chips go in.

custom_steps.title: Chocolate Chips
custom_steps.text: In my recipe, I specify one and a half cups of semi-sweet chocolate, but I'm using one cup of semi-sweet and half a cup of bittersweet.

custom_steps.title: Chocolate Chip Variations
custom_steps.text: You could even use milk chocolate if that's what you prefer. Reserve a handful of semi-sweet chips for sprinkling on top.

custom_steps.title: Fold in Chocolate Chips
custom_steps.text: Fold the chocolate chips in with a spatula, not a whisk.

custom_steps.title: Prepare Muffin Tins
custom_steps.text: After the chocolate chips are folded in, it's time to pop this into the muffin tins.

custom_steps.title: Butter and Flour Muffin Tins
custom_steps.text: I've buttered and floured half of the muffin tins. Move all that flour around and then dump out the excess.

custom_steps.title: Use Muffin Papers
custom_steps.text: For the rest, I'm going to use muffin papers which go a bit higher. They should still rise up with a nice dome.

custom_steps.title: Crispy Muffin Edge
custom_steps.text: Some people prefer that nice crispy muffin edge, so if that's your preference, do it without the papers. Just be careful about adding enough butter and flour so they pop out easily.

custom_steps.title: Fill Muffin Tins
custom_steps.text: Use a large ice cream scooper to transfer the batter into the muffin tin. Fill it up all the way to the brim.

custom_steps.title: Avoid Batter on Edges
custom_steps.text: Try to be careful about getting batter on the edges as it'll burn. It'll still bake fine, but it's just a matter of how it looks.

custom_steps.title: Monitor Chocolate Chips
custom_steps.text: When scooping the batter, monitor the chocolate chips to ensure equal distribution. Scoop up some chips after the batter goes in if needed.

custom_steps.title: Top with Chocolate Chips
custom_steps.text: Top the muffins with a scattering of chocolate chips for nice glossy melty chocolate tops.

custom_steps.title: Ready for Baking
custom_steps.text: This recipe makes exactly 12 big muffins. Now it's time to go into the oven.

custom_steps.title: Bake Muffins
custom_steps.text: Bake at 425 degrees Fahrenheit for five minutes, then reduce the temperature to 350 and bake for 20 to 25 minutes until the top is golden and set in the middle.

custom_steps.title: Check Doneness
custom_steps.text: Insert a skewer through the center and it should come out clean except for the molten chocolate. Then, put the muffins into the oven.

custom_steps.title: Cool Muffins
custom_steps.text: Out of the oven and cooled just enough to touch. Show the difference between the in-paper versus the out-of-paper muffins.

custom_steps.title: Compare Muffins
custom_steps.text: Out-of-paper muffins have a nice crisp edge and are golden brown. In-paper muffins are taller and softer all over.

custom_steps.title: Inside View
custom_steps.text: Take a look at the inside of the muffin.

custom_steps.title: Chocolate Playlist
custom_steps.text: If you like this video, check out my chocolate playlist.

custom_steps.title: Host's Note
custom_steps.text: Someone's making crazy faces behind the camera. Check out my chocolate playlist for all my favorite chocolate recipes.

custom_steps.title: Taste Test
custom_steps.text: Now it's time for a bite. Oh my gosh, do you see how crazy this is? Oh my god, that is so good.

custom_steps.title: Conclusion
custom_steps.text: If you like my videos, hit that like button and subscribe. I'll see you in the next video.

common_steps.title: Combine Wet and Dry Ingredients
common_steps.text: A little heat will fix all of our problems. Give it a whisk to get a nice homogeneous fluid mixture. Pour the wet into the dry, give it a whisk, and take it to almost combined. You could have a couple of clumps of flour hanging out here and there.
common_steps.explanation: Gradually add the dry ingredients to the wet ingredients, mixing until just combined. Avoid over-mixing to ensure the muffins remain tender and fluffy.

common_steps.title: Prepare Add-ins
common_steps.text: We'll do more mixing once those chocolate chips go in. In my recipe, I specify one and a half cups of semi-sweet chocolate, but I'm using one cup of semi-sweet and half a cup of bittersweet. You could even use milk chocolate if that's what you prefer. Reserve a handful of semi-sweet chips for sprinkling on top. Fold the chocolate chips in with a spatula, not a whisk.
common_steps.explanation: If using add-ins like blueberries, chocolate chips, or nuts, coat them lightly with flour to prevent sinking. Gently fold them into the batter.

common_steps.title: Fill Muffin Liners
common_steps.text: After the chocolate chips are folded in, it's time to pop this into the muffin tins. I've buttered and floured half of the muffin tins. Move all that flour around and then dump out the excess. For the rest, I'm going to use muffin papers which go a bit higher. They should still rise up with a nice dome. Some people prefer that nice crispy muffin edge, so if that's your preference, do it without the papers. Just be careful about adding enough butter and flour so they pop out easily. Use a large ice cream scooper to transfer the batter into the muffin tin. Fill it up all the way to the brim. Try to be careful about getting batter on the edges as it'll burn. It'll still bake fine, but it's just a matter of how it looks.
common_steps.explanation: Line a muffin tin with paper liners or grease it. Fill each liner with batter, typically about two-thirds to three-quarters full. Optionally, sprinkle with sugar or streusel topping.

common_steps.title: Monitor Chocolate Chips
common_steps.text: When scooping the batter, monitor the chocolate chips to ensure equal distribution. Scoop up some chips after the batter goes in if needed. Top the muffins with a scattering of chocolate chips for nice glossy melty chocolate tops. This recipe makes exactly 12 big muffins. Now it's time to go into the oven.
common_steps.explanation: Line a muffin tin with paper liners or grease it. Fill each liner with batter, typically about two-thirds to three-quarters full. Optionally, sprinkle with sugar or streusel topping.

common_steps.title: Bake Muffins
common_steps.text: Bake at 425 degrees Fahrenheit for five minutes, then reduce the temperature to 350 and bake for 20 to 25 minutes until the top is golden and set in the middle. Insert a skewer through the center and it should come out clean except for the molten chocolate. Then, put the muffins into the oven.
common_steps.explanation: Preheat the oven to the specified temperature (usually between 350°F and 425°F). Bake the muffins for the recommended time, usually between 20 to 35 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean.

common_steps.title: Cool and Serve
common_steps.text: Out of the oven and cooled just enough to touch. Show the difference between the in-paper versus the out-of-paper muffins. Out-of-paper muffins have a nice crisp edge and are golden brown. In-paper muffins are taller and softer all over. Take a look at the inside of the muffin.
common_steps.explanation: Allow the muffins to cool in the tin for a few minutes before transferring them to a wire rack to cool completely. Serve warm or at room temperature.

subtitles.text: Hey guys, I'm Dina from simplyhomecooked.com and today I'll be showing you how to make these fluffy and moist blueberry muffins
They are loaded with a ton of blueberries and they're topped with a simple and delicious brown sugar streusel
So you want to start off by combining all of your dry ingredients
So in a large bowl combine two cups of all-purpose flour, a teaspoon of baking powder,
half a teaspoon of baking soda, and a quarter teaspoon of salt
Then whisk it all together and reserve one tablespoon of that flour mixture
Now mix that reserve tablespoon of the flour mixture with one-and-a-half cups of fresh blueberries
The reason why we add that little tiny bit of flour to those blueberries is when we add them to the batter
During baking the blueberries don't sink as fast when they're coated in flour
Now add three eggs into a large bowl and whisk them on high speed using an electric mixer
You want to do this for about three minutes until the eggs become fluffy and pale
Then continue beating the eggs as you slowly add one cup of granulated sugar
You'll want to keep beating those eggs for about three more minutes
So the key to really fluffy muffins is well beaten eggs
Now you want to add a teaspoon of vanilla extract and a tablespoon of fresh lemon juice
Now continue beating the egg mixture as you slowly add 3/4 cups of heavy cream
Now you can begin adding your dry ingredients, but don't do it all at once
So get a sifter out and then add about a third of that flour mixture at a time with mixing in between
Once you've got all of your dry ingredients well combined into the muffin batter
Continue beating with your electric mixer as you slowly gradually add in four tablespoons of melted unsalted butter
All right
Now the last and final step is adding in those blueberries and at this point you want to fold it in with a spatula
Now line your muffin tin with cupcake liners and begin scooping the batter out using a large cookie scoop. I
Like to top my blueberry muffins with a few extra blueberries on top, but that's totally optional
And before the muffins go into the oven you want to make that simple streusel. In a small bowl combine a 1 tablespoon of unsalted
cold cubed butter,
2 tablespoons of all-purpose flour, a pinch of salt, a teaspoon of cinnamon, and 3 tablespoons of brown sugar
Mash that all together using a fork until the ingredients are well combined and they have a crumbly texture to them
Now top the blueberry muffins with the streusel topping and bake them in the oven at 350 degrees Fahrenheit for about 35 minutes
I hope you guys enjoyed watching this video and if you did, please be sure to share it, like and subscribe to our channel
So you guys never miss out on any of our new recipes. See you next time

custom_steps.title: Introduction
custom_steps.text: Hey guys, I'm Dina from simplyhomecooked.com and today I'll be showing you how to make these fluffy and moist blueberry muffins.

custom_steps.title: Overview
custom_steps.text: They are loaded with a ton of blueberries and they're topped with a simple and delicious brown sugar streusel.

custom_steps.title: Step 1: Combine Dry Ingredients
custom_steps.text: So you want to start off by combining all of your dry ingredients.

custom_steps.title: Step 1.1: Measure Dry Ingredients
custom_steps.text: In a large bowl combine two cups of all-purpose flour, a teaspoon of baking powder,

custom_steps.title: Step 1.2: Add Remaining Dry Ingredients
custom_steps.text: Add half a teaspoon of baking soda, and a quarter teaspoon of salt.

custom_steps.title: Step 1.3: Whisk Dry Ingredients
custom_steps.text: Then whisk it all together and reserve one tablespoon of that flour mixture.

custom_steps.title: Step 2: Coat Blueberries
custom_steps.text: Mix that reserved tablespoon of the flour mixture with one-and-a-half cups of fresh blueberries.

custom_steps.title: Step 2.1: Reason for Coating Blueberries
custom_steps.text: The reason why we add that little tiny bit of flour to those blueberries is when we add them to the batter.

custom_steps.title: Step 2.2: Prevent Sinking Blueberries
custom_steps.text: During baking the blueberries don't sink as fast when they're coated in flour.

custom_steps.title: Step 3: Beat Eggs
custom_steps.text: Add three eggs into a large bowl and whisk them on high speed using an electric mixer.

custom_steps.title: Step 3.1: Whisk Eggs
custom_steps.text: You want to do this for about three minutes until the eggs become fluffy and pale.

custom_steps.title: Step 4: Add Sugar
custom_steps.text: Continue beating the eggs as you slowly add one cup of granulated sugar.

custom_steps.title: Step 4.1: Beat Eggs and Sugar
custom_steps.text: You'll want to keep beating those eggs for about three more minutes.

custom_steps.title: Step 4.2: Importance of Beaten Eggs
custom_steps.text: The key to really fluffy muffins is well beaten eggs.

custom_steps.title: Step 5: Add Flavorings
custom_steps.text: Add a teaspoon of vanilla extract and a tablespoon of fresh lemon juice.

custom_steps.title: Step 6: Add Heavy Cream
custom_steps.text: Continue beating the egg mixture as you slowly add 3/4 cups of heavy cream.

custom_steps.title: Step 7: Add Dry Ingredients Gradually
custom_steps.text: Begin adding your dry ingredients, but don't do it all at once.

custom_steps.title: Step 7.1: Sift and Mix Dry Ingredients
custom_steps.text: Get a sifter out and then add about a third of that flour mixture at a time with mixing in between.

custom_steps.title: Step 8: Combine Dry Ingredients
custom_steps.text: Once you've got all of your dry ingredients well combined into the muffin batter.

custom_steps.title: Step 9: Add Melted Butter
custom_steps.text: Continue beating with your electric mixer as you slowly gradually add in four tablespoons of melted unsalted butter.

custom_steps.title: Step 10: Prepare for Blueberries
custom_steps.text: All right.

custom_steps.title: Step 10.1: Fold in Blueberries
custom_steps.text: The last and final step is adding in those blueberries and at this point you want to fold it in with a spatula.

custom_steps.title: Step 11: Prepare Muffin Tin
custom_steps.text: Line your muffin tin with cupcake liners and begin scooping the batter out using a large cookie scoop.

custom_steps.title: Step 11.1: Optional Blueberry Topping
custom_steps.text: Top your blueberry muffins with a few extra blueberries on top, but that's totally optional.

custom_steps.title: Step 12: Make Streusel Topping
custom_steps.text: Before the muffins go into the oven you want to make that simple streusel. In a small bowl combine a 1 tablespoon of unsalted.

custom_steps.title: Step 12.1: Add Butter
custom_steps.text: Add cold cubed butter.

custom_steps.title: Step 12.2: Add Remaining Streusel Ingredients
custom_steps.text: Add 2 tablespoons of all-purpose flour, a pinch of salt, a teaspoon of cinnamon, and 3 tablespoons of brown sugar.

custom_steps.title: Step 12.3: Combine Streusel Ingredients
custom_steps.text: Mash that all together using a fork until the ingredients are well combined and they have a crumbly texture to them.

custom_steps.title: Step 13: Bake Muffins
custom_steps.text: Top the blueberry muffins with the streusel topping and bake them in the oven at 350 degrees Fahrenheit for about 35 minutes.

custom_steps.title: Conclusion
custom_steps.text: I hope you guys enjoyed watching this video and if you did, please be sure to share it, like and subscribe to our channel.

custom_steps.title: Final Note
custom_steps.text: So you guys never miss out on any of our new recipes. See you next time.

common_steps.title: Introduction
common_steps.text: Hey guys, I'm Dina from simplyhomecooked.com and today I'll be showing you how to make these fluffy and moist blueberry muffins.
common_steps.explanation: Introduction to the video and the recipe.

common_steps.title: Overview
common_steps.text: They are loaded with a ton of blueberries and they're topped with a simple and delicious brown sugar streusel.
common_steps.explanation: Overview of the recipe and what to expect.

common_steps.title: Prepare Dry Ingredients
common_steps.text: So you want to start off by combining all of your dry ingredients. In a large bowl combine two cups of all-purpose flour, a teaspoon of baking powder, add half a teaspoon of baking soda, and a quarter teaspoon of salt. Then whisk it all together and reserve one tablespoon of that flour mixture.
common_steps.explanation: Combining all-purpose flour, baking powder, and salt in a bowl. Sift or whisk together to ensure even distribution.

common_steps.title: Prepare Add-ins
common_steps.text: Mix that reserved tablespoon of the flour mixture with one-and-a-half cups of fresh blueberries. The reason why we add that little tiny bit of flour to those blueberries is when we add them to the batter. During baking the blueberries don't sink as fast when they're coated in flour.
common_steps.explanation: Coating blueberries with flour to prevent them from sinking during baking.

common_steps.title: Prepare Wet Ingredients
common_steps.text: Add three eggs into a large bowl and whisk them on high speed using an electric mixer. You want to do this for about three minutes until the eggs become fluffy and pale. Continue beating the eggs as you slowly add one cup of granulated sugar. You'll want to keep beating those eggs for about three more minutes. The key to really fluffy muffins is well beaten eggs. Add a teaspoon of vanilla extract and a tablespoon of fresh lemon juice.
common_steps.explanation: Combining wet ingredients such as eggs, sugar, and flavorings. Whisk or beat until well combined.

common_steps.title: Prepare Wet Ingredients
common_steps.text: Continue beating the egg mixture as you slowly add 3/4 cups of heavy cream.
common_steps.explanation: Adding heavy cream to the wet ingredients and mixing well.

common_steps.title: Combine Wet and Dry Ingredients
common_steps.text: Begin adding your dry ingredients, but don't do it all at once. Get a sifter out and then add about a third of that flour mixture at a time with mixing in between. Once you've got all of your dry ingredients well combined into the muffin batter.
common_steps.explanation: Gradually adding the dry ingredients to the wet ingredients, mixing until just combined.

common_steps.title: Prepare Wet Ingredients
common_steps.text: Continue beating with your electric mixer as you slowly gradually add in four tablespoons of melted unsalted butter.
common_steps.explanation: Adding melted butter to the wet ingredients and mixing well.

common_steps.title: Prepare Add-ins
common_steps.text: The last and final step is adding in those blueberries and at this point you want to fold it in with a spatula.
common_steps.explanation: Gently folding in the coated blueberries into the batter.

common_steps.title: Fill Muffin Liners
common_steps.text: Line your muffin tin with cupcake liners and begin scooping the batter out using a large cookie scoop. Top your blueberry muffins with a few extra blueberries on top, but that's totally optional.
common_steps.explanation: Filling muffin liners with batter and optionally adding extra blueberries on top.

common_steps.title: Prepare Add-ins
common_steps.text: Before the muffins go into the oven you want to make that simple streusel. In a small bowl combine a 1 tablespoon of unsalted. Add cold cubed butter. Add 2 tablespoons of all-purpose flour, a pinch of salt, a teaspoon of cinnamon, and 3 tablespoons of brown sugar. Mash that all together using a fork until the ingredients are well combined and they have a crumbly texture to them.
common_steps.explanation: Preparing a streusel topping by combining butter, flour, salt, cinnamon, and brown sugar.

common_steps.title: Bake Muffins
common_steps.text: Top the blueberry muffins with the streusel topping and bake them in the oven at 350 degrees Fahrenheit for about 35 minutes.
common_steps.explanation: Baking the muffins at the specified temperature and time.

common_steps.title: Conclusion
common_steps.text: I hope you guys enjoyed watching this video and if you did, please be sure to share it, like and subscribe to our channel.
common_steps.explanation: Concluding the video and encouraging viewers to engage with the content.

common_steps.title: Final Note
common_steps.text: So you guys never miss out on any of our new recipes. See you next time.
common_steps.explanation: Final note to ensure viewers subscribe for future content.

subtitles.text: Today on The Stay At Home Chef
I'm showing you my master muffin recipe.
Instead of giving you dozens of recipes for different flavors of muffins,

today I'm sharing my master muffin recipe, 
which you can use to make almost any flavor,
and it's super easy.
Start by preheating your oven to 425 degrees Fahrenheit.
Then line a 12 cup muffin tin with paper baking cups.

Then I like to give mine just a spritz of nonstick cooking spray, 
right on those paper baking cups,
to prevent the muffins from sticking.
Now it's time to put together our batter.

First I'm going to demonstrate a basic muffin batter, 
and then I'm going to show you 5 different variations,

each demonstrating a different way 
that you can build upon the base recipe.
The batter starts with 1/2 cup of softened salted butter,
and 1 cup of granulated sugar.
We're going to use a hand mixer to cream this together.

At first this mixture will be lumpy, 
but keep on mixing for about 2 minutes.

After 2 minutes your sugar and butter will be well combined, 
and it'll be a smooth, paste-like, creamy consistency.

Then you'll add in 2 large eggs, 
and mix this briefly until just combined,
about 30 seconds.

Then I'm going to add in 1 teaspoon of vanilla extract, 
or you can use other flavors of extract,
like almond extract, orange extract, lemon extract.
Those are all super popular options.

For the lemon and citrus extracts 
I recommend only using 1/2 teaspoon of those,
and combining that with 1/2 teaspoon of vanilla extract.
You'll also need 2 teaspoons of baking powder,
and 1/2 teaspoon of salt.

This is also the point where you'd add in any spices 
like cinnamon or pumpkin pie spice.

We're gonna give this a quick mix just to combine, 
about 10 seconds.

Now at this point it's time to ditch our hand mixer 
and grab a rubber spatula.
Add in half of your all-purpose flour.

You're going to use 2 cups total, 
so you're going to add in 1 cup right now.
Then use the rubber spatula to stir this in.

Once all those white specks of flour start to disappear, 
you'll pour in 1/2 cup of either milk or buttermilk.
Buttermilk is going to give you a little bit of a poofier muffin.
And you'll stir this in as well until it's well combined.
Last you'll add in the remaining 1 cup of all-purpose flour.

Stir this together scraping the sides and bottom of the bowl 
to ensure that everything gets mixed in.

Now if you're gonna add anything into your muffins, 
like dried fruit, chocolate chips, or berries,
now would be the time to do so.
but I'll show you that in just a minute.
Your batter should be thick but also spreadable.

We're gonna divide the batter up amongst our 12 muffin cups, 
and you should fill each one about 2/3 of the way full.

It's always a little bit hard to tell what's 2/3 or what's 3/4, 
so just try to divide your batter up as evenly as possible,
because this does make 12 muffins.

You can let your muffin batter rest for about 15 minutes 
before popping it in the oven,

or if you're making a larger batch it's totally okay to let it 
rest in between cooking different batches.
Bake your muffins in the 425 degree oven for 7 minutes.
After 7 minutes reduce the temperature on your oven to 350 degrees without opening the oven door.

Continue baking for 12-15 minutes, 
and watch them carefully,
as the cooking time will vary a little bit depending on your oven.

Now let's start going over some variations, 
starting with a lemon blueberry muffin.

This is great because it demonstrates both using 
another flavor of extract as well as adding in fresh fruit.

I've already creamed together the sugar and butter 
and added in the eggs,
so now I'm going to add in 1/2 teaspoon of vanilla extract,

and 1/2 teaspoon of lemon extract 
before adding in my baking powder and salt.

Continue on with the rest of the recipe 
adding in the flour and buttermilk.

Once you have your batter finished 
you'll add in 1 cup of fresh blueberries,

or frozen even, 
you can use those too.

Then this is optional but I like to add in the zest of 1 lemon, 
so about 1 tablespoon of lemon zest.
Then simply fold this in.

Then it's just a matter of once again dividing the batter evenly 
amongst the 12 muffin cups.

One fun topping you can experiment with is sprinkling on about 
1 teaspoon of granulated sugar on top of your muffins.

This gives it a nice little crunchy sweet top, 
and then of course bake these just as we did before.
Next up i'm going to show you how to make a chocolate version.

For a chocolate version you'll use your butter and sugar again 
just like before,

but this time you'll add in 1/2 cup of cocoa powder, 
unsweetened cocoa powder,
and cream that in with it.

From here you'll proceed with the rest of the 
master muffin recipe by adding in eggs,

baking powder, salt, vanilla extract, all-purpose flour, 
and milk or buttermilk.

The addition of the cocoa powder really doesn't do much 
to change the texture of the final batter.

Then just for fun i'm going to add in 
1 cup of semi-sweet chocolate chips,
and fold those in.

Even though you can mix and match add-ins, 
you want to total any additions that you make,

like chocolate chips, or nuts, or dried fruit, 
to 1 cup total.
Next i'm going to show you one of my very favorite muffin hacks

that allows you to switch up with all sorts of different flavors 
by using instant pudding.
This time you're only going to add in 3/4 cup of granulated sugar,

because you're going to replace that additional 1/4 cup 
with a 3.4 ounce package of instant pudding mix,
and this time I'm using pistachio because it's one of my favorite flavors.

Cream this together and then proceed with 
the master muffin recipe as directed.
You could even fold in some chopped pistachios if you wanted.

This variation is fun because there's just 
so many different flavors of instant pudding out there.

It makes it really easy to mix and match flavors really quickly 
without having to buy a bunch of extracts.
Next I want to show just how easy it is to mix and match add-ins
to add a little bit of flavor to the base recipe without too much hassle.

So I'm going to show you a cranberry white chocolate chip 
with a little bit of orange zest.
This is the master recipe with no alterations to it.

I'm going to add in 1/2 cup of dried cranberries because, 
like I said before, we're going to use 1 cup of add-ins total.

That means that the white chocolate chips 
will also come in at 1/2 cup for 1 cup total.

I didn't have any orange extract today but that's okay because, 
a little bit of orange zest,

1-2 tablespoons total, 
will add just a hint of orange flavor.

Once again it's simply a matter of folding this in 
until the ingredients are evenly distributed.

You can do chocolate chips, raisins, nuts, 
really the possibilities are endless.

Last I want to show you how to add in spices which is super easy, 
and I really don't have to show you,

but I thought it would be fun to show a cinnamon muffin 
with cinnamon chips folded in,

topped with a brown sugar streusel, 
and that's just delicious.

I've already creamed together the butter and sugar, 
added in the eggs, baking powder, salt, and vanilla extract,
and now I'm going to add in 1 teaspoon of ground cinnamon.
You can use between 1/2 teaspoon and 1 full teaspoon,

it really just depends on how pronounced you want 
that cinnamon flavor to be.

Finish with the rest of the master muffin recipe 
by adding in the flour and buttermilk.
I'm going to fold in 1 cup of cinnamon chips,

which are delicious but they can be a little harder to find 
when it's not the holidays.

Go ahead and divide up the batter in your prepared muffin cups 
before making your streusel topping.

A streusel is easy to make and it is a decadent addition 
to lots of different flavors of muffins.
It starts with 1/4 cup of cold, cubed butter,

then you'll add in 1/2 cup of brown sugar 
and 1/2 cup of all-purpose flour,
adding in 1/4 teaspoon of ground cinnamon.

Then use a pastry cutter or you can use 2 knives 
cutting across each other like this.

Then you want to cut this all together 
until it resembles a coarse meal or sand.
Then you want to sprinkle this generously on top of your muffin batter.

It's almost like having little piles of sand on top of each muffin, 
and of course the baking time on all of these are the same.

Now you know how to make pretty much any flavor of muffin 
that you want using one master recipe.
Thanks for watching.

You can find the full written recipe 
as well as other flavor ideas in the video description.

Be sure to subscribe, like, and follow, 
and check out the rest of my videos,
where you can find hundreds of restaurant quality recipes
you can easily make at home.
we'll see you later.

custom_steps.title: Introduction
custom_steps.text: Today on The Stay At Home Chef, I'm showing you my master muffin recipe.

custom_steps.title: Overview
custom_steps.text: Instead of giving you dozens of recipes for different flavors of muffins, today I'm sharing my master muffin recipe, which you can use to make almost any flavor, and it's super easy.

custom_steps.title: Preheat Oven
custom_steps.text: Start by preheating your oven to 425 degrees Fahrenheit.

custom_steps.title: Prepare Muffin Tin
custom_steps.text: Line a 12 cup muffin tin with paper baking cups and give them a spritz of nonstick cooking spray to prevent the muffins from sticking.

custom_steps.title: Prepare Batter
custom_steps.text: First, I'm going to demonstrate a basic muffin batter, and then I'm going to show you 5 different variations, each demonstrating a different way that you can build upon the base recipe.

custom_steps.title: Cream Butter and Sugar
custom_steps.text: The batter starts with 1/2 cup of softened salted butter and 1 cup of granulated sugar. Use a hand mixer to cream this together for about 2 minutes until smooth and creamy.

custom_steps.title: Add Eggs
custom_steps.text: Add in 2 large eggs and mix briefly until just combined, about 30 seconds.

custom_steps.title: Add Extracts
custom_steps.text: Add in 1 teaspoon of vanilla extract or other flavors like almond, orange, or lemon extract. For citrus extracts, use 1/2 teaspoon and combine with 1/2 teaspoon of vanilla extract.

custom_steps.title: Add Dry Ingredients
custom_steps.text: Add 2 teaspoons of baking powder, 1/2 teaspoon of salt, and any spices like cinnamon or pumpkin pie spice. Mix briefly to combine.

custom_steps.title: Add Flour and Milk
custom_steps.text: Add half of the 2 cups of all-purpose flour (1 cup) and stir in with a rubber spatula. Then pour in 1/2 cup of milk or buttermilk and stir until well combined.

custom_steps.title: Add Remaining Flour
custom_steps.text: Add the remaining 1 cup of all-purpose flour and stir together, scraping the sides and bottom of the bowl to ensure everything is mixed in.

custom_steps.title: Add Mix-ins
custom_steps.text: If adding mix-ins like dried fruit, chocolate chips, or berries, now is the time to do so.

custom_steps.title: Fill Muffin Cups
custom_steps.text: Divide the batter among the 12 muffin cups, filling each about 2/3 of the way full. Try to divide the batter evenly.

custom_steps.title: Rest Batter
custom_steps.text: Let the muffin batter rest for about 15 minutes before baking, or rest between cooking different batches if making a larger batch.

custom_steps.title: Bake Muffins
custom_steps.text: Bake in the 425-degree oven for 7 minutes. Then reduce the temperature to 350 degrees without opening the oven door and continue baking for 12-15 minutes.

custom_steps.title: Lemon Blueberry Muffin Variation
custom_steps.text: Start with the base recipe and add 1/2 teaspoon of vanilla extract, 1/2 teaspoon of lemon extract, and 1 cup of fresh or frozen blueberries. Optionally, add 1 tablespoon of lemon zest.

custom_steps.title: Chocolate Muffin Variation
custom_steps.text: Add 1/2 cup of unsweetened cocoa powder to the butter and sugar mixture. Proceed with the rest of the master muffin recipe and fold in 1 cup of semi-sweet chocolate chips.

custom_steps.title: Pudding Mix Muffin Variation
custom_steps.text: Use 3/4 cup of granulated sugar and replace the additional 1/4 cup with a 3.4-ounce package of instant pudding mix. Proceed with the master muffin recipe.

custom_steps.title: Cranberry White Chocolate Muffin Variation
custom_steps.text: Add 1/2 cup of dried cranberries, 1/2 cup of white chocolate chips, and 1-2 tablespoons of orange zest to the base recipe.

custom_steps.title: Cinnamon Muffin Variation
custom_steps.text: Add 1 teaspoon of ground cinnamon to the base recipe. Fold in 1 cup of cinnamon chips and top with a brown sugar streusel.

custom_steps.title: Make Streusel Topping
custom_steps.text: Combine 1/4 cup of cold, cubed butter, 1/2 cup of brown sugar, 1/2 cup of all-purpose flour, and 1/4 teaspoon of ground cinnamon. Use a pastry cutter to mix until it resembles coarse meal. Sprinkle on top of muffin batter.

custom_steps.title: Conclusion
custom_steps.text: Now you know how to make pretty much any flavor of muffin that you want using one master recipe.

custom_steps.title: Outro
custom_steps.text: Thanks for watching. You can find the full written recipe and other flavor ideas in the video description. Be sure to subscribe, like, and follow, and check out the rest of my videos for more recipes.

common_steps.explanation: The host explains the purpose of the video and the versatility of the master muffin recipe.

common_steps.text: Start by preheating your oven to 425 degrees Fahrenheit.
common_steps.explanation: The first step in the process is to preheat the oven.

common_steps.title: Prepare Muffin Tin
common_steps.text: Line a 12 cup muffin tin with paper baking cups and give them a spritz of nonstick cooking spray to prevent the muffins from sticking.
common_steps.explanation: Preparation of the muffin tin is essential to ensure the muffins do not stick.

common_steps.title: Prepare Batter
common_steps.text: First, I'm going to demonstrate a basic muffin batter, and then I'm going to show you 5 different variations, each demonstrating a different way that you can build upon the base recipe.
common_steps.explanation: The host introduces the basic muffin batter and mentions upcoming variations.

common_steps.title: Cream Butter and Sugar
common_steps.text: The batter starts with 1/2 cup of softened salted butter and 1 cup of granulated sugar. Use a hand mixer to cream this together for about 2 minutes until smooth and creamy.
common_steps.explanation: The first step in preparing the batter is to cream the butter and sugar together.

common_steps.title: Add Eggs
common_steps.text: Add in 2 large eggs and mix briefly until just combined, about 30 seconds.
common_steps.explanation: Eggs are added to the creamed butter and sugar mixture.

common_steps.title: Add Extracts
common_steps.text: Add in 1 teaspoon of vanilla extract or other flavors like almond, orange, or lemon extract. For citrus extracts, use 1/2 teaspoon and combine with 1/2 teaspoon of vanilla extract.
common_steps.explanation: Flavor extracts are added to the mixture.

common_steps.title: Add Dry Ingredients
common_steps.text: Add 2 teaspoons of baking powder, 1/2 teaspoon of salt, and any spices like cinnamon or pumpkin pie spice. Mix briefly to combine.
common_steps.explanation: Dry ingredients are added to the mixture.

common_steps.title: Add Flour and Milk
common_steps.text: Add half of the 2 cups of all-purpose flour (1 cup) and stir in with a rubber spatula. Then pour in 1/2 cup of milk or buttermilk and stir until well combined.
common_steps.explanation: Half of the flour and the milk are added to the mixture.

common_steps.title: Add Remaining Flour
common_steps.text: Add the remaining 1 cup of all-purpose flour and stir together, scraping the sides and bottom of the bowl to ensure everything is mixed in.
common_steps.explanation: The remaining flour is added and mixed in.

common_steps.title: Add Mix-ins
common_steps.text: If adding mix-ins like dried fruit, chocolate chips, or berries, now is the time to do so.
common_steps.explanation: Optional mix-ins are added to the batter.

common_steps.title: Fill Muffin Cups
common_steps.text: Divide the batter among the 12 muffin cups, filling each about 2/3 of the way full. Try to divide the batter evenly.
common_steps.explanation: The batter is divided into the muffin cups.

common_steps.title: Rest Batter
common_steps.text: Let the muffin batter rest for about 15 minutes before baking, or rest between cooking different batches if making a larger batch.
common_steps.explanation: The batter is allowed to rest before baking.

common_steps.title: Bake Muffins
common_steps.text: Bake in the 425-degree oven for 7 minutes. Then reduce the temperature to 350 degrees without opening the oven door and continue baking for 12-15 minutes.
common_steps.explanation: The muffins are baked in the oven.

common_steps.title: Lemon Blueberry Muffin Variation
common_steps.text: Start with the base recipe and add 1/2 teaspoon of vanilla extract, 1/2 teaspoon of lemon extract, and 1 cup of fresh or frozen blueberries. Optionally, add 1 tablespoon of lemon zest.
common_steps.explanation: A variation of the master muffin recipe with lemon and blueberries.

common_steps.title: Chocolate Muffin Variation
common_steps.text: Add 1/2 cup of unsweetened cocoa powder to the butter and sugar mixture. Proceed with the rest of the master muffin recipe and fold in 1 cup of semi-sweet chocolate chips.
common_steps.explanation: A variation of the master muffin recipe with chocolate.

common_steps.title: Pudding Mix Muffin Variation
common_steps.text: Use 3/4 cup of granulated sugar and replace the additional 1/4 cup with a 3.4-ounce package of instant pudding mix. Proceed with the master muffin recipe.
common_steps.explanation: A variation of the master muffin recipe with pudding mix.

common_steps.title: Cranberry White Chocolate Muffin Variation
common_steps.text: Add 1/2 cup of dried cranberries, 1/2 cup of white chocolate chips, and 1-2 tablespoons of orange zest to the base recipe.
common_steps.explanation: A variation of the master muffin recipe with cranberries and white chocolate.

common_steps.title: Cinnamon Muffin Variation
common_steps.text: Add 1 teaspoon of ground cinnamon to the base recipe. Fold in 1 cup of cinnamon chips and top with a brown sugar streusel.
common_steps.explanation: A variation of the master muffin recipe with cinnamon.

common_steps.title: Make Streusel Topping
common_steps.text: Combine 1/4 cup of cold, cubed butter, 1/2 cup of brown sugar, 1/2 cup of all-purpose flour, and 1/4 teaspoon of ground cinnamon. Use a pastry cutter to mix until it resembles coarse meal. Sprinkle on top of muffin batter.
common_steps.explanation: Instructions for making a streusel topping.

common_steps.title: Conclusion
common_steps.text: Now you know how to make pretty much any flavor of muffin that you want using one master recipe.
common_steps.explanation: The host concludes the video by summarizing the versatility of the master muffin recipe.

common_steps.title: Outro
common_steps.text: Thanks for watching. You can find the full written recipe and other flavor ideas in the video description. Be sure to subscribe, like, and follow, and check out the rest of my videos for more recipes.
common_steps.explanation: The video ends with a thank you message and a call to action for viewers.
